snippet: A survey of American colleges and universities found that many had gone years without investigating a sexual assault.
abstract: Survey of American colleges and universities conducted by office of Sen Claire McCaskill of Missouri finds 40 percent of respondents have gone five years without investigating a sexual assault, including 6 percent of the largest publicly financed institutions.
lead_paragraph: A survey of American colleges and universities found that many had gone years without investigating a sexual assault.

headline.main: Survey Finds Low Rate of Sexual Assault Inquiries at Colleges
headline.print_headline: Survey Finds Low Rate of College Sex-Assault Inquiries
